bugs.title: CVE-2019-12515 xpdf: out-of-bounds read in function FlateStream::getChar() in Stream.cc [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12515 xpdf: out-of-bounds read in function FlateStream::getChar() in Stream.cc [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12515 xpdf: out-of-bounds read in function FlateStream::getChar() in Stream.cc

long_desc.thetext:
There is an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the function FlateStream::getChar() located at Stream.cc in Xpdf 4.01.01. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftoppm tool. It might allow an attacker to cause Information Disclosure or a denial of service.

Reference:
https://github.com/PanguL4b/pocs/tree/master/xpdf/out-of-bounds-read-in-FlateStream__getChar

bugs.title: CVE-2019-12493 xpdf: stack-based buffer over-read in function PostScriptFunction::transform in Function.cc [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-12493 xpdf: stack-based buffer over-read in function PostScriptFunction::transform in Function.cc [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12493 xpdf: stack-based buffer over-read in function PostScriptFunction::transform in Function.cc

long_desc.thetext:
A stack-based buffer over-read exists in PostScriptFunction::transform in
Function.cc in Xpdf 4.01.01 because GfxSeparationColorSpace and
GfxDeviceNColorSpace mishandle tint transform functions. It can, for example, be
triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftops tool. It might allow
an attacker to cause Denial of Service or leak memory data.

Reference:
https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=41806

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12957 xpdf: buffer over-read in FoFiType1C::convertToType1 in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc

long_desc.thetext:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, a buffer over-read could be triggered in FoFiType1C::convertToType1 in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc when the index number is larger than the charset array bounds. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftops tool. It allows an attacker to use a crafted pdf file to cause Denial of Service or an information leak, or possibly have unspecified other impact.

Reference:
https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=41813

Created xpdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1725690]

Created xpdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1725691]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-12958 xpdf: buffer over-read in FoFiType1C::convertToType0 in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc

long_desc.thetext:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, a heap-based buffer over-read could be triggered in FoFiType1C::convertToType0 in fofi/FoFiType1C.cc when it is trying to access the second privateDicts array element, because the privateDicts array has only one element allocated.

Reference:
https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=41815

bugs.title: CVE-2019-13283 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in FoFiType1::parse in fofi/FoFiType1.cc [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13283 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in FoFiType1::parse in fofi/FoFiType1.cc [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-13283 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in FoFiType1::parse in fofi/FoFiType1.cc

long_desc.thetext:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, a heap-based buffer over-read could be triggered in strncpy from FoFiType1::parse in fofi/FoFiType1.cc because it does not ensure the source string has a valid length before making a fixed-length copy. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftotext tool. It allows an attacker to use a crafted pdf file to cause Denial of Service or an information leak, or possibly have unspecified other impact.

Reference:
https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=41843

Created xpdf tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2019-13282 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in SampledFunction::transform in Function.cc [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13282 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in SampledFunction::transform in Function.cc [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-13282 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in SampledFunction::transform in Function.cc

long_desc.thetext:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, a heap-based buffer over-read could be triggered in SampledFunction::transform in Function.cc when using a large index for samples. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftotext tool. It allows an attacker to use a crafted pdf file to cause Denial of Service or an information leak, or possibly have unspecified other impact.

Reference:
https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=41842

Created xpdf tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2019-13281 xpdf: heap-based buffer overflow in DCTStream::decodeImage() in Stream.cc [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13281 xpdf: heap-based buffer overflow in DCTStream::decodeImage() in Stream.cc [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-13281 xpdf: heap-based buffer overflow in DCTStream::decodeImage() in Stream.cc

long_desc.thetext:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, a heap-based buffer overflow could be triggered in DCTStream::decodeImage() in Stream.cc when writing to frameBuf memory. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftotext tool. It allows an attacker to use a crafted pdf file to cause Denial of Service, an information leak, or possibly unspecified other impact.

Reference:
https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=41841

bugs.title: CVE-2019-13286 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in function JBIG2Stream::readTextRegionSeg() in JBIG2Stream.cc [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2019-13286 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in function JBIG2Stream::readTextRegionSeg() in JBIG2Stream.cc [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2019-13286 xpdf: heap-based buffer over-read in function JBIG2Stream::readTextRegionSeg() in JBIG2Stream.cc

long_desc.thetext:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in the function
JBIG2Stream::readTextRegionSeg() located at JBIG2Stream.cc. It can, for example,
be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftoppm tool. It might
allow an attacker to cause Information Disclosure.

Reference:
https://github.com/PanguL4b/pocs/tree/master/xpdf/heap-buffer-overflow_JBIG2Stream__readTextRegionSeg

Created xpdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1728104]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1728103]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====
